article:
Bratislav}}


 Bratislava is in southwestern
Slovakia, occupying both banks of the Danube River and the left bank of the
Morava River. Bordering Austria and Hungary, it is the only national capital
that borders two independent countries.

Bratislava is the political, cultural, and economic centre of Slovakia. It is
the seat of the Slovak president, the parliament, and the Slovak Executive. It
is home to several universities, museums, theatres, galleries and other
important cultural and educational institutions. Many of Slovakia's large businesses and financial
institutions also have headquarters there.

The history of the city has been strongly influenced by people of different
nations and religions, namely by Austrians, Czechs, Germans, Hungarians, Jews,
and Slovaks (in alphabetical order, not significance). The city was the capital of the Kingdom of
Hungary, a part of the larger Habsburg Monarchy territories,
from 1536 to 1783 and has been home to many Slovak, Hungarian, and German
historical figures.
